subject: Re: [junit] Re: Using JUnit with Java Web Start
msgSnippet: ... I guess I am still missing what it is you are trying to achieve with this approach.  Are you trying to have the tests run everytime someone runs the app?
messageBody:
--- christina_norwood <christina_norwood@...>
wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Shane Mingins
> <shanemingins@y...> wrote:
> > --- christina_norwood <christina_norwood@b...>
> > wrote:
> >
> > > I have tried to use Java Web Start to download
> > > JUnit.jar and run the
> > > Swing TestRunner.
> >
> > I am kind of curious ... why are you doing this?
> >
> I am looking at ways to enable unit testing (and
> other java
> applications) for some fairly inexperienced users.
> I've had problems
> with web start with another small application I
> developed too, so I'm
> exploring it's limits.
>

I guess I am still missing what it is you are trying
to achieve with this approach. Are you trying to have
the tests run everytime someone runs the app? Who are
reffering to with the word "users"? Users of the app?

I have used web start for a few apps. It a way of
deploying an application. I am unsure why I would
want it to run my junit tests. I would want my junit
tests to run before I made the app available to the
users via web start.

If you wish, tell us more.

Cheers
Shane











Shane Mingins

shanemingins@...

please remove clothes before emailing
